reviewText: I love this video to walk to.  It is so real, you just forget that you are not right there in the mountains walking.  I would highly  recommend this video ...
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love the Ambient Collection. I have several of them and find them to be an decent alternative to actually walking in nature, a joy that is greatly limited where I live.  The scenery on this DVD is absolutely gorgeous.  I love how the creators were conscious of those of us who are afraid of heights by not showing potential drop offs on the edges of some of the passes and seldom using passes with great height on the one side of the road.That said, I will, however, only use Track 2: Road to Village on my workouts. I have ruled out using all of the others. Despite the gorgeous scenery, even one car is not a tranquil walk for me.  I walk in nature to be part of nature and be away from anything human, if possible, especially human caused noise.  Although the quaint village at the end of the track 2 walk is a human element, it makes me feel like I have come home (sorta') at the end of my walk, and I am okay with that.Although it is infrequent, I was dismayed on the other four tracks to see vehicles periodically.  And this could pretty much have been avoided by transitioning to a different scene right before a vehicle showed on the road. As another note, I would never choose to walk on an actual paved road for any distance--only if absolutely necessary to get to my tranquil nature path.  I would not want to be confronted by vehicles during my walk.  I walk for health, not to inhale exhaust.  I know there is no exhaust on the DVD, but I immerse myself in the scenery. The roads on the four tracks that I prefer not to use for my workouts use paths that appear to be major roads. It may be that many have no problem with this, but it is too much civilization for me on a nature exercise walk. I look for entirely country settings.I do plan to keep the DVD, though, as, for me, the Road to the Village is worth the cost.I would still like for the creators to make a DVD of the four seasons.  Forest settings of all four seasons--one track for spring (with blooming wild/native flowers), another for summer, another for fall (with fall colored leaves), and a fourth for winter (with snow).
Title: N/A

reviewText: Very nice change during the winter months when cannot go out walking due to inclement weather (such as had all this winter 2013-14).  Like how it automatically loops each track.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I own other "walking & running" videos and often watch movies tor scenery videos to pass the time. This video had great scenes and gave me a break from my normal dull routine. I mainly use the elliptical and air-bike which was well suited for this video and for my less frequent treadmill running the medium speed also worked great.
summary: This video was great mind candy for passing time
Title: N/A

reviewText: 2 months ago I purchased a Treadmill with the IFit program. Though I love how I feel AFTER the workout, it gets a bit boring, staring at the walls. So I went on line and looked for virtual fitness DVD's and found this among many others. I have since started a small library of these kind of video's and I LOVE them!I start my treadmill and the IFit program and select an IFit workout from my program. For this one I used a mountain map that I had created myself.Then I put the Fitness Journey tape into my laptop, place the laptop on my treadmill and play the DVD on my Laptop while I walk/jog or sprint.I live in a suburb of DFW and miss nature walks. This is perfect for that! The sound of the birds, bees and the wind let you forget that you are inside on a boring treadmill.
Title: N/A
